user_message:
<target code>Here is the code that failed to compile:
```c

static int
mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#if defined(HAVE_CPUSET_GETAFFINITY)
  /* FreeBSD style */
  {
    FILE *log_file = fopen("/tmp/logs/138.txt", "a");
    if (log_file != NULL)
    {
      fprintf(log_file, "Initial ret value = %d\n", ret);
    }
  }
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    FILE *log_file = fopen("/tmp/logs/138.txt", "a");
    if (log_file != NULL)
    {
      fprintf(log_file, "Entering first if-block because 0 >= ret (ret = %d)\n", ret);
    }
    cpuset_t cur_mask;
    /* The should get "anonymous" mask/set. The anonymous mask is always
       a subset of the assigned set (which is a subset of the root set). */
    if (0 == cpuset_getaffinity (CPU_LEVEL_WHICH, CPU_WHICH_PID, (id_t) -1,
                                 sizeof (cur_mask), &cur_mask))
    {
#ifdef HAVE_CPU_COUNT
      ret = CPU_COUNT (&cur_mask);
#else  /* ! HAVE_CPU_COUNT */
      unsigned int i;
      ret = 0;
      for (i = 0; i < CPU_SETSIZE_SAFE; ++i)
      {
        if (CPU_ISSET (i, &cur_mask))
          ++ret;
      }
      if (0 == ret)
        ret = -1;
#endif /* ! HAVE_CPU_COUNT */
    }
  }
#ifdef HAVE_CPU_COUNT_S
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    FILE *log_file = fopen("/tmp/logs/138.txt", "a");
    if (log_file != NULL)
    {
      fprintf(log_file, "Entering second if-block because 0 >= ret (ret = %d)\n", ret);
    }
    /* Use 256 times larger size than size for default maximum CPU number.
       Hopefully it would be enough even for exotic situations. */
    static const unsigned int mask_size_cpus = 256 * CPU_SETSIZE;
    const size_t mask_size_bytes = CPU_ALLOC_SIZE (mask_size_cpus);
    cpuset_t *p_mask;

    p_mask = CPU_ALLOC (mask_size_cpus);
    if (NULL != p_mask)
    {
      if (0 == cpuset_getaffinity (CPU_LEVEL_WHICH, CPU_WHICH_PID, (id_t) -1,
                                   mask_size_bytes, p_mask))
      {
#ifndef MHD_FUNC_CPU_COUNT_S_GETS_CPUS
        ret = CPU_COUNT_S (mask_size_bytes, p_mask);
#else  /* MHD_FUNC_CPU_COUNT_S_GETS_CPUS */
        ret = CPU_COUNT_S (mask_size_cpus, p_mask);
#endif /* MHD_FUNC_CPU_COUNT_S_GETS_CPUS */
      }
      CPU_FREE (p_mask);
    }
  }
#endif /* HAVE_CPU_COUNT_S */
#endif /* HAVE_CPUSET_GETAFFINITY */
  if (0 >= ret)
    return -1;
  return ret;
}

```
</target code>

<response format>
Provide your answer with these answers.
- fixed_test_code: the fixed test code that compiles successfully.
- explanation: a brief explanation of the changes you made to fix the code.
Here are the constraints for the test code:
- The test code MUST be compilable and executable.
- The test code MUST include line breaks.
- The test code MUST preserve the original logic of mhd_tool_get_proc_cpu_count_cpuset_getaffinity_ as much as possible.
- You MUST not define the main function.
- You MUST not define macros.
- The test code MUST not contain any mock functions.
</response format>
<instruction>
Please fix the code so that it compiles successfully.
</instruction>
explanation: The original build error was related to 'makeinfo' missing on the system, which is unrelated to the actual C source code. The provided C code snippet itself did not contain errors preventing compilation. However, within the function, there were opened FILE pointers that were not closed, which can be problematic or flagged by some compilers or static analyzers. To ensure the source code compiles cleanly and properly manages resources, I added fclose calls after each fopen and usage of log_file. This preserves the original logic, adds proper resource management, and ensures no file descriptor leaks that could cause compilation warnings or runtime issues.
